title: Mikadodu13
author: Mikadodu13
created_time: September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AMLast edit: October 12, 2022, 05:10:48 PM by Mikadodu13
content: hello, I create this topic concerning the decoin scam project I would like to know if anyone else has lost money on decoin?the platform has been inactive for 15 days, it is impossible to reach them by email, 100 emails in 15 days, I guess the project is dead..

comments.author: Ucy
comments.body: Quote from: Mikadodu13 on September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AMhello, I create this topic concerning the decoin scam project is "surely msko the next one"I would like to know if anyone else has lost money on decoin?the platform has been inactive for 15 days, it is impossible to reach them by email, 100 emails in 15 days, I guess the project is dead..by the way there is the same decoin team working on this project "https://www.muskotiers.com/" I went to their telegram to ask for explanations... the answer was clear "ban"..here I am creating this topic in prevention..good day to all ..Is there something they owe you you want to get back? You should try asking the msko team member/members about it privately. So far I notice one member who is/was part of the decoin team.

comments.author: Mikadodu13

You should try asking the msko team member/members about it privately. So far I notice one member who is/was part of the decoin team.hello, yes I have $2000 blocked on decoin!I went to ask for information on msko telegram, the answer was quick "ban"...in the msko team you had 3 people who are part of the decoin team! ain't just the ceo mr shay perry!

You should try asking the msko team member/members about it privately. So far I notice one member who is/was part of the decoin team.hello, yes I have $2000 blocked on decoin!I went to ask for information on msko telegram, the answer was quick "ban"...in the msko team you had 3 people who are part of the decoin team! ain't just the ceo mr shay perry!Try and see if you can speak to them privately to hear them first before deciding on next course of action. I'd advise you to move this thread to Scam Accusations section here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=83.0 , Â will follow the case there

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: If decoin scammed, you create a proper scam accusation in the board suggested to you by one of the members.If you have strong proof linking Decoin to MSKO you can also create a free scam accusation about them with all the evidence so that members can stay away from both projects. It's the best thing you can do right now.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: Mikadodu13 on September 29, 2022, 06:31:24 AMQuote from: JeromeTash on September 28, 2022, 09:47:55 PMIf decoin scammed, you create a proper scam accusation in the board suggested to you by one of the members.If you have strong proof linking Decoin to MSKO you can also create a free scam accusation about them with all the evidence so that members can stay away from both projects. It's the best thing you can do right now.I have proof, it's not a problem.. linking mr shay perry, decoin to msko is not very difficult.. he doesn't even hide.. linking members of their teams who are also in the 'team' decoin, it's not difficult too.. .. i even have a telegram message with an msko admin who offers me to try to solve the problem with decoin, then who is not even in the team decoin.. I will wait a little longer to see where this discussion will with this person before making a complete summary of the situation..Again if you have proof that the project or the people behind it is a scam then post it on the Scam Accusation board: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=83.0.And maybe we will see someone from their group to answer your queries. But in any case, I would advise that you should treat your money as gone already.But giving the community a warning about this project could prevent others to fall for their trick.

comments.author: Mikadodu13
comments.body: Quote from: Kemarit on September 29, 2022, 06:37:07 AMQuote from: Mikadodu13 on September 29, 2022, 06:31:24 AMQuote from: JeromeTash on September 28, 2022, 09:47:55 PMIf decoin scammed, you create a proper scam accusation in the board suggested to you by one of the members.If you have strong proof linking Decoin to MSKO you can also create a free scam accusation about them with all the evidence so that members can stay away from both projects. It's the best thing you can do right now.I have proof, it's not a problem.. linking mr shay perry, decoin to msko is not very difficult.. he doesn't even hide.. linking members of their teams who are also in the 'team' decoin, it's not difficult too.. .. i even have a telegram message with an msko admin who offers me to try to solve the problem with decoin, then who is not even in the team decoin.. I will wait a little longer to see where this discussion will with this person before making a complete summary of the situation..Again if you have proof that the project or the people behind it is a scam then post it on the Scam Accusation board: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=83.0.And maybe we will see someone from their group to answer your queries. But in any case, I would advise that you should treat your money as gone already.But giving the community a warning about this project could prevent others to fall for their trick.yes I consider this money already lost .. even if this scam remains incomprehensible in view of what I got from this platform compared to what I lost .. (20k in 2 years, for 2k lost ..)but it's not the lost money that bothers me, it's especially that I don't see any people complaining about this scam..a platform which crashes in the middle of the day is which then becomes inactive, which cuts all dialogue at once, nobody worries about it .. in short, I will wait for the weekend to see how the discussion with the msko administrator is going , dst following what will tell me, I will make a complete summary with more direct accusations..

But in any case, I would advise that you should treat your money as gone already.But giving the community a warning about this project could prevent others to fall for their trick.yes I consider this money already lost .. even if this scam remains incomprehensible in view of what I got from this platform compared to what I lost .. (20k in 2 years, for 2k lost ..)but it's not the lost money that bothers me, it's especially that I don't see any people complaining about this scam..a platform which crashes in the middle of the day is which then becomes inactive, which cuts all dialogue at once, nobody worries about it .. in short, I will wait for the weekend to see how the discussion with the msko administrator is going , dst following what will tell me, I will make a complete summary with more direct accusations..Part of my role is to help you recover what they owe you, but if you already considered it gone then there is little I can do to help except advising others to beware of scams.If it's a genuinely scam company/organization I believe there will be punishment unless they give people back their funds/assets. Apology maybe accepted if the victims forgive them.You should conclude your conversation with the Msko administrator, let's see what he has to say or whether he can be of any help.

Apology maybe accepted if the victims forgive them.You should conclude your conversation with the Msko administrator, let's see what he has to say or whether he can be of any help. Hello, I think the money is lost.It's now been 3 weeks since the platform has given any sign of life..I am trying to chat with a msko admin who is trying to contact the founders of the decoin project, because it is the same CEO as on decoin, there are also 2 other decoin people in the msko project..I give them until Sunday to find a solution, if no agreement is found, I will make a more complete summary of the situation on Monday..

If it's about the lost money then don't give up so easily. Your desire to recover it will also determine how fast or how possibly it's recovered

Hello, I think the money is lost.It's now been 3 weeks since the platform has given any sign of life..I am trying to chat with a msko admin who is trying to contact the founders of the decoin project, because it is the same CEO as on decoin, there are also 2 other decoin people in the msko project..I give them until Sunday to find a solution, if no agreement is found, I will make a more complete summary of the situation on Monday..What solution are you trying to find exactly? If it's about the lost money then don't give up so easily. Your desire to recover it will also determine how fast or how possibly it's recoveredhello, having contacted an msko admin, he told me that he was trying to reach the members of the decoin team to find out more because I explained that I would not let go the case is that I will continue to put messages on all the projects where a member of the decoin team is in it is that it could harm the project on which my message will be deposited, it would be a shame for them if I continued to bombard their twitter / telegram / Facebook message asking for a explanation on the decoin scam, especially if on their side they have nothing to reproach themselves with (the msko administrator with whom I am discussing seems to be quite well known from my research and he looks legitimate, I hope that a solution will be found with him..) I will be more tomorrow, he is aware that a post on bitcointalk has been opened and depending on the turn of events, I will go to the direct accusations and this will also harm msko projects too. .

comments.author: Lantind
comments.body: Quote from: Mikadodu13 on September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AMhello, I create this topic concerning the decoin scam project is "surely msko the next one"I would like to know if anyone else has lost money on decoin?I can't confirm if it's a scam or not, but when I tried to open a Decoin exchange, I didn't receive a confirmation email to login, so I couldn't enter the exchange. I'm sure this exchange is in trouble, at least they have an error in setting the confirmation email.

comments.author: Mikadodu13
comments.body: Quote from: Lantind on October 02, 2022, 10:01:15 PMQuote from: Mikadodu13 on September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AMhello, I create this topic concerning the decoin scam project is "surely msko the next one"I would like to know if anyone else has lost money on decoin?I can't confirm if it's a scam or not, but when I tried to open a Decoin exchange, I didn't receive a confirmation email to login, so I couldn't enter the exchange. I'm sure this exchange is in trouble, at least they have an error in setting the confirmation email.Hello, the platform is still alive.. but impossible to connect to it for 3 weeks.. all trading has been abruptly stopped.. no more access to the platform with my alts blocked on it.. impossible to send an email to support, it has been deactivated.. I also tried to contact them directly by email, no response as well..I am waiting to see the discussion with the msko admin today is further to what will tell me, I will open a more complete scam report on decoin..ps/ it's not that I refuse to report a scam, it's that it takes time to translate the report into English to try to be understood as best as possible..

comments.author: jbflori
comments.body: Why anybody speak about this exchange ? The theft of 33 millions by decoin.io . No news, no talk about this, why ?

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: Mikadodu13 on September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AM...the platform has been inactive for 15 days, it is impossible to reach them by email, 100 emails in 15 days, I guess the project is dead..I think that you will not be able to get your money back. Nevertheless, I am interested in the question, for what reason did you choose this exchange? That they offered you that you entrusted them with your money, while there are many centralized and decentralized exchanges with a good reputation.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: jbflori on December 10, 2022, 09:36:13 AMWhy anybody speak about this exchange ? The theft of 33 millions by decoin.io . No news, no talk about this, why ?I never heard of this exchange, and others might also barely know it. Contrary to the FTX which has a lot of popularity and shill way before its insolvency, surely the public are concerned so does the media. FTX was also one of the exchanges that has a big trading volume. That explains the example of why its fall down is a contagion to the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Back to the Decoin, I don't know how popular this exchange was, and how many users are affected. There is a reason why the media does not bring up this news. If you are affected and think the general cryptocurrency user should consider this theft or scam allegation, you should be the one who informed the communities in regard to it, after then it is up to the community whether they will resonate with the news or not.

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Quote from: tvplus006 on December 10, 2022, 08:57:56 PMQuote from: Mikadodu13 on September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AM...the platform has been inactive for 15 days, it is impossible to reach them by email, 100 emails in 15 days, I guess the project is dead..I think that you will not be able to get your money back. Nevertheless, I am interested in the question, for what reason did you choose this exchange? That they offered you that you entrusted them with your money, while there are many centralized and decentralized exchanges with a good reputation.This platform was one of the ICO projects that succeeded in collecting significant funds from investors to establish the platform. The platform has an official announcement here on the forum, and it has also launched a Bounty campaign to introduce the ICO program. What is interesting is that the platform has been operating since 2018, and it seems that it has real problems that were addressed in one of the discussions on Reddit, but there are no other discussions or many reviews about it.DECOIN: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/decoin/Announcement thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3311450Bounty thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3311816.0 (Failed to pay participants)Discussion in Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/BonfireToken/comments/nf5mau/decoin_exchange_scammers/

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: If we are talking about this Decoin, reports of the scam began a month ago, in November. Then users reported problems with withdrawal of funds and complete ignoring of emails. I tried to go to the project site itself, there hangs an error 503. It is possible that the team made a trivial exit scam.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: Mikadodu13 on September 28, 2022, 05:54:41 AMI would like to know if anyone else has lost money on decoin?the platform has been inactive for 15 days, it is impossible to reach them by email, 100 emails in 15 days, I guess the project is dead..As for me, I did not lose my money because I did not trust this exchange before or its currency, after looking at the feedback of DECOIN customers, I see that there are many who lost thousands of dollars because this exchange blocked their accounts and did not even answer their emails to this day, and also the DTEP currency of this exchange when investors bought it, they were unable to sell it. The currency team is the one that manipulates its price and its source code. We have to know that scammers are everywhere around us, so these exchange platforms are less reliable, so staying away from them will be the solution, so why risk our funds in unknown exchange platforms and currencies like this?

comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: Quote from: jbflori on December 10, 2022, 09:36:13 AMWhy anybody speak about this exchange ? The theft of 33 millions by decoin.io . No news, no talk about this, why ?It's caused by most of people in here were not using decoin. That's why people rarely talked about that. The site gone offline and nothing can be expected to be returned by scammer. The only possible thing to track the identity from the owner and then take legal action against them but the problem since those scammers might be on abroad and then you will be so difficult to catch them all. The scammer has been erasing everything now. It's become even harder to track where the money was going on. I didn't know why stupid people keep used this garbage exchange site when it was still alive.
